rules: Rule1: If the show is renewed, then it achieves high ratings.
Rule2: Provided that the game is popular, it follows that the game is complex.
Rule3: Under the condition that the show is promoted by the network, then if the show is scheduled in prime time, it is not cancelled.
Rule4: If the show features a celebrity, then the show is promoted by the network.
Rule5: A contestant winning a prize implies that the contestant performs a skill.
Rule6: Either a contestant wins a prize or a contestant eliminates an opponent.
Rule7: Under the condition that a contestant uses a drug, then if the contestant eliminates an opponent, the show airs.
Rule8: Provided that a game requires furniture, furniture is available in the studio.
Rule9: If furniture is damaged, then it is not the case that furniture is available in the studio.
Rule10: Either a sponsor approves the show and game or it is not the case that the game requires furniture.
Rule11: Whenever the show and drug are legal, a sponsor does not approve the show and game.
Rule12: If it is not the case that requiring furniture implies the game is popular, then the show is cancelled.
Rule13: Provided that it is not the case that not featuring a celebrity implies the show violates regulations, then the show is fined.
Rule14: Under the condition that it is not the case that not featuring a celebrity implies the show violates regulations, then the show is not fined.
Rule15: Whenever a contestant does not use a drug, the game requires furniture.
Rule16: Under the condition that the show and drug are not legal, the show is renewed.
Rule17: Provided that the show and drug are not legal, it is not the case that the show achieves high ratings.
facts: Fact1: The show is scheduled in prime time.
Fact3: It is not the case that a contestant performs a skill.
Fact4: The game is not complex.
Fact5: The show does not violate regulations.
